Nirvikalpaka and Savikalpaka Pratyakṣa
3. Nirvikalpaka and Savikalpaka Pratyakṣa

The Sanskrit term kalpanā is variously translated as
imagination or conceptual construction and is meant to be the source
of ‘vikalpa’, roughly translated as concepts, but
which may stand for anything that the mind adds to the
‘given’. The time-honored differentiation of perception
into conception-free perception (nir-vikalpa pratyakṣa)
and conception-loaded perception (sa-vikalpa
pratyakṣa) is made on the basis of concepts
(vikalpa) (Matilal, 1986: 313).
